intro: Valeriana glauca, commonly known as blue valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces numerous tiny flowers in clusters at the top of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Valeriana glauca is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
